Adaptive Template System

Adaptive Template System

ATS module¶

ATS.Annulus(N=200, r=1, R=2, seed=None)[source]¶

Returns point cloud sampled from uniform distribution on annulus in R^2 of inner radius r and outer radius R

Parameters

  • N (int) – Number of points to generate

  • r (float) – Inner radius of the annulus

  • R (float) – Outer radius of the annulus

  • seed (float) – Fixes the seed. Good if we want to replicate results.

Returns

Numpy 2D array – A Nx2 numpy array with the points drawn as the rows.

ATS.Circle(N=100, r=1, gamma=None, seed=None)[source]¶

Generate N points in R^2 from the circle centered at the origin with radius r.

If gamma != None, then we add normal noise in the normal direction with std dev gamma.

Parameters

  • N (int) – Number of points to generate

  • r (float) – Radius of the circle

  • gamma (float or 'None') – Stan dard deviation of the normally distributed noise.

  • seed (float or 'None') – Fixes the seed. Good if we want to replicate results.

Returns

numpy 2D array – A Nx2 numpy array with the points drawn as the rows.

ATS.Clusters(N=100, centers=array([[0, 0], [3, 3]]), sd=1, seed=None)[source]¶

Generate k clusters of points, N points in total. k is the number of centers.

Parameters

  • N (int) – Number of points to be generated

  • centers (numpy array) – k x d numpy array, where centers[i,:] is the center of the ith cluster in R^d.

  • sd (numpy array) – standard deviation of clusters.

  • seed (float) – Fixes the seed.

Returns

numpy array – A Nxd numpy array with the points drawn as the rows.

ATS.Cube(N=100, diam=1, dim=2, seed=None)[source]¶

Generate N points in the box [0,diam]x[0,diam]x…x[0,diam]

Parameters

  • N (int) – Number of points to generate

  • diam (float) – lenght of one side of the box

  • dim (int) – Dimension of the box; point are embbeded in R^dim

Returns

numpy array – A Nxdim numpy array with the points drawn as the rows.

ATS.Sphere(N=100, r=1, noise=0, seed=None)[source]¶

Generate N points in R^3 from the sphere centered at the origin with radius r. If noise is set to a positive number, the points can be at distance r +/- noise from the origin.

Parameters

  • N (int) – Number of points to generate

  • r (float) – Radius of the sphere

  • seed (float) – Fixes the seed. Good if we want to replicate results.

Returns

Numpy 2D array – A Nx3 numpy array with the points drawn as the rows.

ATS.Torus(N=100, r=1, R=2, seed=None)[source]¶

Generates torus with points x = ( R + r*cos(theta) ) * cos(psi), y = ( R + r*cos(theta) ) * sin(psi), z = r * sin(theta)

Parameters

  • N (int) – Number of points to generate

  • r (float) – Inner radius of the torus

  • R (float) – Outer radius of the torus

  • seed (float) – Fixes the seed. Good if we want to replicate results.

Returns

numpy 2D array – A Nx3 numpy array with the points drawn as the rows.

ATS.box_centers(list_dgms, d, padding)[source]¶

This function computes the collection of centers use to define tent functions, as well as the size the tent.

Parameters

  • list_dgms (list) – List of persistent diagrmas

  • d (int) – number of a bins in each axis.

  • padding (float) – this increases the size of the box aournd the collection of persistent diagrmas

Returns

numpy array, float – d x 2 array of centers, size of the tent domain

ATS.f_box(x, center, delta)[source]¶

Computes the function

\[g_{(a,b), \delta}(x) = \max \left\{ 0,1 - \frac{1}{\delta} \max\left\{ | x-a | , | y-b | \right\} \right\}\]
Parameters

  • x (numpy array) – point to evaluate the function \(g_{(a,b), \delta}\).

  • center (numpy array) – Center of the tenf function.

  • delta (float) – size fo the tent function domain.

Returns

float – tent function \(g_{(a,b), \delta}(x)\) evaluated at x.

ATS.f_dgm(dgm, function, **keyargs)[source]¶

Given a persistend diagram \(D = (S,\mu)\) and a compactly supported function in \(\mathbb{R}^2\), this function computes

\[\nu_{D}(f) = \sum_{x\in S} f(x)\mu(x)\]
Parameters

  • dgm (Numpy array) – persistent diagram, array of points in \(\mathbb{R}^2\).

  • function (function) – Compactly supported function in \(\mathbb{R}^2\).

  • keyargs (Dicctionary) – Additional arguments required by funciton

Returns

float – value of \(\nu_{D}(f)\).

ATS.f_ellipse(x, center=array([0, 0]), axis=array([1, 1]), rotation=array([[1, 0], [0, 1]]))[source]¶

Computes a bump function centered with an ellipsoidal domain centered ac c, rotaded by ‘rotation’ and with axis given by ‘axis’. The bump function is computed using the gollowing formula

\[f_{A,c} (x) = \max \left\{ 0, 1 - (x - c)^T A (x - c)\right\}\]
Parameters

  • x – point to avelatuate the function \(f_{A,c}\)

  • center (Numpy array) – center of the ellipse

  • axis (Numpy array) – Size f themjor an minor axis of the ellipse

  • rotation (Numpy array) – Rotation matrix for the ellipse

Returns

float – value of \(f_{A,c} (x)\).

ATS.f_gaussian(x, center=0, axis=1, rotation=1)[source]¶

Computes

\[g(x) = \frac{1}{\sigma \sqrt{2\pi}} e^{- \left( \frac{x-\mu}{\sqrt{2}\sigma} \right)^2}\]
Parameters

  • x (numpy array) – point to evaluate \(g\) at

  • center (float) – mean of the gaussian

  • axis (float) – standard deviation

Returns

numpy array – \(g(x)\).

ATS.feature(list_dgms, function, **keyargs)[source]¶

Given a collection of persistent diagrams and a compactly supported function in \(\mathbb{R}^2\), computes \(\nu_{D}(f)\) for each diagram \(D\) in the collection.

Parameters

  • list_dgms (list) – list of persistent diagrams

  • function (function) – Compactly supported function in \(\mathbb{R}^2\).

  • keyargs (Dicctionary) – Additional arguments required by funciton

Returns

Numpy array – Array of values \(\nu_{D}(f)\) for each diagram \(D\) in the collection list_dgms.

ATS.get_all_features(list_dgms, list_ellipses, function)[source]¶

This function computes all the features for a colelction of persistent diagrams given a list ot ellipses.

Parameters

  • list_dgms (list) – list of persistent diagrams

  • list_ellipses (list) – List of dicctionaries. Each dicctionary represents a ellipse. It must have the following keys: mean, std and rotation.

  • function (function) – Compactly supported function in \(\mathbb{R}^2\).

ATS.limits_box(list_dgms)[source]¶

This function computes the min and max of a collection of pers. dgms. in the birth-lifespan space.

Parameters

list_dgms (list) – List of persistent diagrmas

Returns

list – mins = [min_birth, min_lifespan] and maxs = [max_birth, max_lifespan]

ATS.testSetManifolds(numDgms=50, numPts=300, permute=True, seed=None)[source]¶

This function generates persisten diaglams from point clouds generated from the following collection of manifolds

  • Torus

  • Annulus

  • Cube

  • 3 clusters

  • 3 clusters of 3 clusters

  • Sphere

The diagrmas are obtained by computing persistent homology (using Ripser) of sampled point clouds from the described manifolds.

Parameters

  • numDgms (int) – Number of diagrmas per manifold

  • numPts (int) – Number of point per sampled point cloud

  • permute (bool) – If True it will permute the final result, so that diagrams of point clouds sampled from the samw manifold are not contiguous.

  • seed (float) – Fixes the random seed.

Returns

pandas data frame – Each row corersponds to the 0- and 1-dimensional persistent homology of a point cloud sampled from one of the 6 manifolds.
